thread.title: Male Cheerleaders Are Back in the NFL: Here's Where Denver Stands
thread.title_full: Male Cheerleaders Are Back in the NFL: Here's Where Denver Stands

author: Nate Wilde
title: Male Cheerleaders Are Back in the NFL: Here's Where Denver Stands
text:
Will Colorado Ever See Male NFL Cheerleaders? Here’s What We Know
It was recently announced that the Minnesota Vikings would be introducing multiple male cheerleaders to their roster for the 2025-2026 NFL Season.
This announcement was met with a variety of reactions, from praise to disdain to indifference.
While not overtly common, male cheerleaders are nothing new, as former United States President was a male cheerleader many years before being elected, and the late comedian and actor Robin Williams even made a hilarious one-time appearance as a male cheerleader for the Denver Broncos back in the 1970s.
So, the question must be asked: Will the Denver Broncos see the return of male cheerleaders in 2025, like the Minnesota Vikings?
Will Colorado Have Male NFL Cheerleaders in 2025?
According to the official website of the Denver Broncos, the team will include a total of 28 cheerleaders for the 2025-2026 season, all of whom are female.
While Denver does not appear to be employing any male cheerleaders for the upcoming NFL season, the Minnesota Vikings are far from the only team that will be in 2025.
What Teams Besides the Minnesota Vikings Have Male Cheerleaders?
According to a new article from Newsweek, a total of 11 NFL teams have male cheerleader on their rosters for the upcoming 2025-2026 season.
Read More: What’s Wrong With Empower Field At Mile High Stadium?
These teams include the aforementioned Minnesota Vikings, as well as the Baltimore Ravens, Los Angeles Rams, New England Patriots, New Orleans Saints, Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Tennessee Titans, San Francisco 49ers, Philadelphia Eagles, Washington Commanders, and the Seattle Seahawks.
Denver Broncos 2025 Schedule
Denver Broncos2025 season could be one of their best in recent years, as Bo Nix moves into his second season and Head Coach
Sean Paytonmoves into his third.
